items.q: Which of these is the capital city of Japan?
items.explanation: Tokyo is one of the most populous metropolises in the world.

items.q: Canada is the second largest country in the world by land area.
items.explanation: Russia is the largest, followed directly by Canada.

items.q: The Amazon Rainforest is located in Africa.
items.explanation: The Amazon Rainforest is located in South America, primarily within Brazil.

items.q: What is the capital city of the United States?
items.explanation: It is not geographically located within any U.S. state, functioning as a federal district.

items.q: Name the 50th state to join the United States.
items.explanation: Hawaii was formally admitted as a state in August 1959.

items.q: What do you call a mountain that erupts with lava?
items.explanation: Volcanoes have vents that allow molten rock and gases from beneath the Earth's crust to erupt.

items.q: Which continent is known for having penguins and very cold temperatures?
items.explanation: It is the southernmost continent on Earth and contains the geographic South Pole.

items.a: A piece of land almost entirely surrounded by water but connected to the mainland on one side.
items.explanation: Florida and Italy are well-known examples of peninsulas.

items.q: What currency is commonly used across many nations in Europe?
items.explanation: The Euro is the official currency of 20 of the 27 member states of the European Union.

items.q: Which ocean lies directly between North America and Europe?
items.explanation: It separates the 'Old World' from the 'New World'.
